pages.text: The $(thing)Steam Generator$() is the heart of your electrical network. When placed above a heat source, it consumes water and produces electricity, or $(thing)FE$().$(br2)Water can either be brought in with buckets using the input slot, or piped in from another source.
The higher the temperature, the faster the $(thing)Steam Generator$() consumes water and produces electricity.$(br2)$(thing)FE$() can be extracted using an $(thing)Energy Pipe$().

It is important to make sure you have enough $(thing)FE storage$() to capitalize on the entirety of your fuel's burn time.$(br2)Electricity for running machines is expensive, so try to not be wasteful.$(br2)The thermometer in the interface is different than other heat producing sources since it shows the temperature up to its highest functioning value.
